inn1.comm: gets forward and across to push the ball to the off side. Two slips in place. Shahid Afridi tossed the coin and the Canada captain called it wrong. He later said, he would have loved to bat first
taps this close on the leg side, towards square-leg for a quick single
A good catch has been taken but t'was a free hit of course. Shahzad backed away and had a slog; the ball ballooned beyond backward point where the fielder took it, lunging forward
gets forward to tap this to mid-on
full delivery around off, driven to mid-off
swings in to the pads, rolls away to the on side
gets forward and across to defend to the off side
length delivery outside off and moves away further, left alone
drags this short and Hafeez plays a crunching pull over midwicket

And again. Short and ready to be whacked. More lollypops, wonder whether they are still popular in Canada. I don't see much of them in India anymore. It sucks. Meanwhile, Hafeez, swivels back to play a rollicking pull shot. Pretty stylish execution.
leans well forward and shoulders arms
leans across to steer to third man
good-length delivery just outside off stump, defended back to the bowler
sprays to the pads and it rolls away behind square=leg
short in length and on the pads, clipped past square-leg
good-length delivery just outside off stump, pushed out to the off
cuts in from around off stump, moves past the prod and hits the thigh pad
moves in from just outside off stump, tapped to short midwicket
fuller and tilting in from just outside off stump, driven to the off side of the pitch

Given out and Hafeez goes for UDRS. LBW. It landed on a good length outside off stump and moved in to hit the pad above the knee roll in front of leg and middle stump. The height was in question. And would it have hit the leg stump? Hawk eye says it would have clipped the top of the leg stump. And that has been given out.
lands on a good length outside off and moves in towards middle, defended on the back foot
in the zone outside off, Kamran thinks about having a go but decides to withdraw his bat at the last instant
well outside the off stump, Kamran watches it sail through to the keeper
taps this to the left of backward point for a single
short and wide, Kamran reaches out to mistime his cut shot. The ball rolls to point
stays back to defend a short-of-length delivery towards mid-offf
hint of inswing and Shahzad gets behind the line to tap it to the on side. Good delivery that. Can he hurl it a tad fuller, though?
again movement in from short of length and that allows Shahzad to sit back and push it to the on side
he bowls this fuller but he tries to take it the other way and ends up with no swing. It's an overpitched delivery in the end and Shehzad creams it to left of mid-off
takes a couple of steps down the track and the bowler drags back the length; Shehzad defends
offers width outside off and short as well, ShEhzad cuts hard but point intercepts
banged in short and it flies high over the batsman's head.

short in length and it moves away from the off stump. STrange half-shot from Kamran. He tried to play a horizontal shot but was sort of trying a weak tap. The ball hits the bat face, turned down, and it bounces before it reaches the keeper
lands well outside off and veers further away
Short again. width as well. Whacked. Kamran cracks it through covers. He reached out to play a cracking cut
That's the delivery to  bowl: Full in length and it swing away. Kamran stumbles forward as he tries to drive and the ball shaves past the edge
full in length again and Kamran taps it to backward point
another good delivery; he seems to have found the right length to bowl now. It lands on a good length and unlike the previous two deliveries, this one comes back in. Kamran defends to point
fuller, Kamran leans across to drive to cover
short and wide, cut to point
short and wide again, Kamran cuts it straight to point
short in length, closer to the off, Kamran stands on his toes to punch it to point
sprays this wide down the leg side.
gets behind the line to defend to the off side
In the zone outside off, left alone
gets forward and across to drive to cover
wide delivery outside off, he tries to carve it through the off side but can't reach the ball
gets behind the line to defend to the off side
full in length and outside off, left alone
in the channel outside off, left alone
full in length outside off, driven wide of mid-off for a single
almost a catch but it's a four! Kamran flicked uppishly and it almost carried to the sub at short fine-leg. He didn't move forward, tried to lunge out but it fell short and ran past him
full delivery on the middle and leg, curves towards middle, driven down the track
on the middle and leg, keeper standing up to the stumps, tucked away to short midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched to point

moves outside leg stump and the bowler follows him with a good-length delivery. Shehzad doesn't connect with an intended on-the-up drive and the ball goes through the bat and pad gap; the keeper couldn't get across in time
He moves outside leg again, and cuts a delivery just outside off over point
And he has imploded. The adrenalin was kicking in. He tries to heave this delivery on the up and over mid-on but couldn't clear. Gordon dived forward to take a good low catch.
full in length, cutting away from the off, run down to third man
full in length and seaming away like a leg cutter, left alone
short in length outside off, pushed out to cover
slips this down the leg side for a wide
probing delivery around the off stump line, defended to the off
leans forward to steer this to backward point
gets behind the line to defend compactly to the off side. Good tight over so far
full in length, around off, Younis pushes it out to the off side.
another one on a good length around off stump, defended on the front foot
leans well forward to jab this full-length delivery to the on side
just outside off stump, defended to the off side
It was the short of length delivery outside off stump and cut away very hard to point. For a moment, I thought it was a dropped chance
in the zone outside off, Younis tries to force it through the off side but is beaten
leans forward to play a crisp cover drive but can't pierce the field
short in length and well outside off, chopped down to third man
wide outside off, Younis has a go but can't reach
Yet another wide delivery. He has to control his swing
just outside off stump, pushed out to cover
short in length outside off, run down to third man
full in length and a lot straighter, pushed back down the track
eases this to the on side of the pitch
just outside off stump, Kamran retains the strike with a dab to third man
What a lovely inswinger! Full in length and it curved in the air. Kamran stumbled out and was beaten on the drive, as he went too much inside the line
gets forward to defend to the on side
runs this down to third man for a single
drags this one short and Younis pulls - he doesn't quite time it well but manages to drag it wider and over mid-on

Younis trapped lbw. He charges up to Kamran, has a chat, and asks for UDRS. It was a full delivery on the middle, tilting in towards middle and leg. Younis played all around it and would have lost the leg stump. Three down and wobbling. What a start this by Canada.
moves in towards the middle and leg, again looking for lbw, but Misbah ensures his front foot doesn't come in the way as he tucks the ball to square-leg
full in length outside off, defended on the front foot

loud appeal for a stumping! They refer it upstairs. Misbah shouldered arms. Keeper collected and waited. Misbah's back foot was inside the crease and he lifted the heel but he had his toes on the ground. The keeper whipped off the bails and appealed. Not out
leans forward to defend
in the zone outside off, left alone
homing in on the off stump, tapped back down the track
really full delivery on the pads, flicked to deep square-leg
stays back to defend to the point region
Ah loverly late cut! It was a good-length delivery just outside off, Kamran was on the front foot when he opened the bat face and ran it through vacant slip region. Keeper was up to the stumps.
Ah! Same zone , same shot attempted but this ball cut away like a leg cutter and flashed past the edge
goes for the inswinger this time and it moves down leg, the keeper whips off the bails and appeals to the main umpire. . Good take that.
cuts in to the pads and brushes the pad en route to the keeper
goes for the off drive but ends up edging it to the square-leg region. The bowler smiles

Tries the bouncer, Misbah allows it fly over his shoulder and it was too much for Ashish Bagai, who seems a very good keeper, to stop. He jumped up with an outstretched left hand but it flew over him quickly
leans forward to defend the good-length delivery to the off
full in length on the middle, keeper is up to the stumps again, driven to mid-on
leans well forward to defend down the track

67 for 4. The minnows are mincers. It was a short of length delivery and there was some width on it but Kamran cut it straight to backward point. The shot was on but the execution was poor. Kamran mutters to himself as he drags himself off the park.
Lovely off drive. He leaned well forward to caress it to the right of the diving mid-off fielder
leans well forward to defend to the off side
just outside off stump, edges the defensive poke wide of backward point
leans forward to defend it to the off side. He used the bat there. The head was over the ball. Sorry, couldn't resist that.
just outside off, defended to the off
good strangling full length delivery that straightens on the off stump line, Umar pushed inside the line, perhaps thinking it will cut in and edges it to point. The bowler smiles.

Whoa! Baidwan tries to make the batsman use his head. Literally., A sharp well-directed bouncer and Umar took the bottom-hand off the handle and managed to fend it to the off side. (keeper was standing back)
tries to cut this one away but can't pierce the off-side field
short in length, on the off stump line, pushed back to Baidwan. Fine over this.
on the middle stump line, turned past square-leg
Keeper standing up. Full and on the pads, flicked away for a single
gentle seam-up delivery around off, eased to point
And again.

full in length on the middle and off line, driven down the track and it ricochets of the stumps. The bowler got a hand on it before it hit the stumps and so they refer upstairs. But Misbah had his bat inside the crease
leans forward to push to the point region
short in length around off, pushed out to the off

run out of Misbah missed. It was pushed to the on side of the pitch, say towards a very straightish short mid-on. The bowler dashes across the pitch to stop it but stumbled and fell in the process. Meanwhile the batsmen were going for a suicidal single. Baidwan was on the ground when he fired the throw. the ball went ahead of Misbah but missed the stumps!
gets behind the line of a good-length delivery to defend

almost caught A better fielder would have got to it? Maybe .. may be not. Well, a taller one would certainly have. It was the surprise bouncer from Baidwan and it was outside off stump. Misbah mistimed the pull and it popped just over square-leg. Jimmy Hansra was stationed there forward of square-leg and he leaped but the ball just about eluded him. It went very slowly but it just about sailed over. Ooh!
no drama this deliver as Umar carefully negotiates this one
gets behind the line to defend this one
turns this one to square-leg
nice teasing full delivery outside off that curves away, Umar thinks about the off drive but decides to let it go through to the keeper
Fine delivery. It was full in length and straightened outside off. Umar tried to defend inside the line and the ball rushed past the edge
full and well outside the off stump, seams away, left alone
gets forward to push this back to the bowler
stays back to push it out to cover
flighted leg break outside leg stump, tapped to the on side
nice flighted leg break around off and middle, eased to cover
gets back to push this leg break back to the bowler
tosses this up on a length outside off, driven to long-off
fuller, on the middle, Misbah pings long-on
lands around off and turns away. Umar, who loves to cut, goes for it but the ball breaks away and almost takes the edge.
full in length around off, pushed out to the off side
slightly slower, on the off, tapped back to the bowler
pushes this wide outside off stump and the umpire extends his arms
in the channel outside off stump, left alone
cuts away in the zone outside off stump, left alone
full n length around off stump line, Misbah gets forward to push it cautiously to the off side
fuller, on the middle and off line, straightens, Misbah was looking to on drive and ends up squirting this to the off.
He loves to cut yes but also delights in playing the slog sweeps. He clears the front foot and swings this leg break on the middle and leg line over midwicket boundary
And Balaji tosses the next one even more, Umar on drives to long-on
on the pads, worked through backward square-leg
lands outside off and turns away, Umar tries to cut but no wood on leather
nice googly, flighted as well, Umar picks it and defends back down the track
rips this legbreak outside off, full in length, Umar tries to force it through point and is beaten. Both bowler and batsman eye ball each other.
on the off and middle line, pushed to the on side
this one is well outside off, goes past the attempted square drive and Ashish Bagai continues to impress with his keeping skills. He was standing up to the stumps and took it neatly
pushes this wide of mid-on for a single
leans across to tap this to backward point
gets forward to squeeze this one to square-leg region
around the off and middle line, pushed back to the bowler
leg break on the off stump line, defends to the off side
presses right back to defend a delivery that skids on almost straight
nicely flighted leg break around off, driven to cover
lands it slightly short and Umar finally connects one of his cut shots. This one races away to the point boundary
goes right back to work this through to wide long-on for a single
flighted leg break on the off, driven to cover
whipped away off the pads, can't bowl there, he gets it in the gap between deep square leg and fine leg to bring up the 100
again, too straight, he shuffles across the stumps to work it away in front of square
comes forward languidly and looks to drive this one through extra cover, but gets an inside edge that goes to the bowler
better line to Misbah now, just around the off stump, and it is pushed away in front of point, Misbah seeks a run, there isn't any
this time there is, it is very full on middle, and is eased down to the man at long on
Umar gets forward confidently, meets the length ball with the full face of the bat and sends it speeding to long off
tossed up nicely, he drives with the turn to long off, Balaji tries to stop it but cannot
again he tries to stop the drive to long off, this time from Misbah, but the ball eludes him
more runs, all down to long off, busy man in these stages of the innings
stretches forward and pushes out this flatter one to point
down the pads, but misbah cannot capitalise, takes it on the pads while looking to whip it away
the Misbah forward block, lunges out full stretch, bat nicely aside pad, and kills the spin
calmly punched away off the back foot, this back of a length stuff has proved difficult to get away
this time he punches in the gap through extra cover, but there is a man at sweeper cover
goes deep in the crease, plays as straight as possible and pushes this length ball to mid on
now comes forward, looking to work it away with the angle through midwicket, cannot beat the infield
down to long on for the easiest of singles
Umar gets the single wide of long on, standing on the crease and punching hard down to the man on the boundary
stretches really forward to get to the pitch of this flighted ball, and drives wristily down to long off with the turn
is that a chance? it was tossed up and took the leading edge in the air, but just fell short of a diving Balaji, lovely ball
beats him in flight again, he was looking to drive this one away, but it took the outside edge and rolled away wide of the keeper on the off side
does not help by dropping it short now, Misbah gleefully gets off strike with a savage pull to deep midwicket
whipped away off the pads wide of midwicket, again a touch short allowing him to go back
wow, that is some turn, Misbah had thought he could defend this turning delivery, but it went square past his bat, keeper did well to take it wide outside off
defended down the track off the front foot
full toss outside off from round the stumps, and he helps himself to a single to sweeper cover
punched away straight to midwicket
gets the single now, it was dropped a touch short, and Misbah whips it through square leg
pushed out in to the off side off the front foot
tidy start from Hansra, Umar gets forward and threads a push-drive to extra cover
turns across Misbah, who goes very deep in the crease, creates the room, and punches for a single to long on
goes well forward and blocks off the front foot
has had enough of defending, comes down the track, goes inside out over extra cover with the turn, and collects four
this one turns away sharply, he is ready for the cut, but hits it out to backward point
taps into covers and wants the single, sent back rightly by Misbah
ooh, he was done in by the dip on this one, came haring down the pitch, but in the end saw it wasn't there to be lofted and played it out to point in the end
Misbah is ready with the reverse paddle even before the ball has been delivered, that it is a full toss on off stump helps, just wrists it past the keeper
cut away powerfully off the back foot, deep point tidies up
pushes out a full toss to midwicket, will be disappointed with that
gets the run now, slight mix-up, but all is well as he whips the ball wide of midwicket and completes the run
Umar picks one down to long on, easy pickings, as it were
fires one in from round the stumps, he punches it back to the bowler who saves a run with his diving effort
Umar likes the flight that Balaji gives the ball, takes it from the middle stump, couple of steps and as clean a swing as any, brings up 1000 runs with the straight boundary
pushes out with the turn to point off the front foot
wants another boundary down the ground, but this time the ball is not quite there, touch flatter, and he steers to short third man in the end
whipped away down to deep midwicket, it was shorter this time and he quickly went ton the back foot
slapped away off the back foot to sweeper cover
tossed up slowly, Misbah comes forward even more slowly in defence, but Balaji was the slowest in putting in a reluctant dive to try and stop the ball
fuller from round the wicket, played back down the track
the angle is making him move about the crease to create space, but cannot get the dab wide of short third man
and again, cannot beat short third man with the steer, tight line this, around off stump
nudged away wide of midwicket, and they take the third for the overthrow as the ball ricochets off he keeper's pads, good running
defended back to the bowler
Misbah shows some urgency, shuffles and sends this one wristily past the square leg umpire to retain strike
rolls away off the pads down the leg side
tossed up full and went straight on, he was looking to flick it, and was hit on the pads, way outside leg though
this is super running, Umar hustled Misbah back for the second as this one was punched in front of long on, Misbah puffed back but was safe in the end
goes for the big lofted shot now, but gets it off the bottom edge towards  midwcket
tight line on middle, flatter too, he goes forward in defence

that's gone, Balaji has his man after lots of effort, it was bowled shorter, flatter, Umar went on the back foot looking for the turn, there wasn't any, it hurried on after pitching to strike him in front of middle stump, there is no doubt about that one, what a time to strike, Umar was looking to up the rate
punched hard off the back foot to sweeper cover, Afridi is on strike now to loud cheers
right away looks to go hard at this full delivery, off the inside edge to midwicket
he is away, Afridi gets one short, he is not going to back off, swivels and pulls it wide of deep midwicket
and another one, the crowd comes to life, he gets underneath a fullish one, and  sends it over mid off, just one bounce before it finds the rope
gets one on the pads, and flicks it in a flash wide of deep square leg
good slower one, Misbah reads it off the pitch, and does the dead block
bowls one on the pads, he flicks it away through midwicket, he will certainly go at the legspinner
Misbah the nurdler, Misbah the paragon of non-violence, gets one full on off stump, reverse paddles it with the turn wide of short third man, it his first boundary in 60 balls
whipped away wide of midwicket, picked the googly and played it with the turn
he almost nudged his away to another boundary here, it was tickled fine but short fine leg put in the big dive, the bowler applauds
fired in quicker, he is forward in tight defence, the ball rolls away on the leg side
pushed out in front of cover off the front foot
turned away off the pads with a flick of the wrists wide of square leg
whoa, he stands a foot outside leg stump, and takes it off the middle stump, and cuts it away to sweeper cover
down the track comes Shahid, and belts down the ground to long off
another Misbah nudge in front of square leg, and another comfortable single
the Afridi pull to a short one, the ball survives the hammering, picked up on the bounce by deep midwicket
full on the pads, played away towards deep square leg
Msibah goes for another of his delicate reverse sweeps, this time its straight to short third man

what have we here? Misbah is gone, but what a way to depart, it was going straight down the leg side, Misbah decided to have those fine tickles, but this time it was the finest of them, and settled into Bagai's gloves, lovely anticipation from the keeper
the googly, he reads it off the pitch, and works it away on the leg side
Afridi does not care what is happening at the other end, thrashes a full one down to long off
tries to do a Misbah, but Razzaq does not get a tickle on this wide down the leg side
punched in to the off side for a run
lovely one, tossed up and goes on with the angle outside off stump, he goes pushing at it and missed
goes back to a shorter one and bashes it away to sweeper cover
keeps low on the pads, he works it backward of square leg
cut away off the back foot to sweeper cover
guided backward of point off the back foot
lifts a full one down the ground to long off
makes some room, and drives a length ball to extra cover who is on the edge of the circle
floated up slowly outside off stump, he wants to drive it. but is beaten
goes for this widish one outside off stump, and gets a thick outside edge, third man was too square for it
right forward to the pitch of a length ball outside off, and drives hard, but extra cover is  in the way

dear me, Afridi has given it away, not for the first time, not for the last, it was a wayward full toss wide outside off stump, Afridi reached out and went swinging wildly at it, and the chance was happily swallowed at backward point, Canada are delighted
Bagai goes up in appeal, it was full in the blockhole outside off stump, goes away from Gul who jabs down at it, Bagai thought there was an edge, the umpire didn't

huge wicket, Hansra roars, tossed up on middle stump, Razzaq wanted to flick it from the crease, played all around it in the end, flicking across the line, that is dead plumb, Razzaq is a goner, two more to go, can Pakistan  get past 200?
this one hurries on straight with the angle, he pushes out at it and is beaten. Hansra smiles
quicker one outside off, jabbed away to point

Balaji it is at slip, and he has somehow managed to hold on to this outside edge, between his legs, it was there for the drive, he went for the drive, the edge flew to Balaji who grabbed at it twice, but it was destined to settle between his thighs as he went down, remember Tariq Iqbal, the Kenya keeper 'catching' Brian Lara in the 1996 World Cup, it was that kind of 'catch'
played back to the bowler
comes forward in defence and gets an inside edge in to the leg side
loops away in the air near the square leg umpire, but there is no one there, Gul gets away

wafting across the line and is hit on the pads, Canada think they have finished off Pakistan, but umpire thinks its too high, Bagai takes the review only for replays to confirm that the ball would have gone over off stump
goes for the bouncer, bounces high over the batsman
Gul steps out and gets the cover drive off the middle of the bat, too bad extra cover had to get in the way
97.6 kph slower ball, bowled from the back of the hand, moves away from Ajmal who tries to pull it sheepishly
that will do, full and on the stumps, Canada's version of Malinga if you please, Ajmal plays all over it, and the ball thuds in to the off stump, Pakistan fall well short of 200 in the end

inn2.comm: gets behind the line to push this full-length delivery to mid-off
hits this on the up to right of mid-off for a single. High back lift.
slips this wide down the leg side
lands on a good length just outside off, Kumar leans across to push it to cover
good delivery, cuts away from back of length outside off and that length allows the batsman to adjust and steer it down to third man
goes for a big hit, a swat pull attempted and the ball rolls away of the pad. Looks like Gunasekara is in the mood to attack
lands on a good length outside off and shapes in, Kumar gets across to defend and it hits him high on the pad. Was there an inside edge as well
Big movement there. It swung away in the air and cut away past the off stump, Kamran goes diving to his left to make a half stop. It just about died before him
on the pads and it has been clipped past square-leg for couple of runs
full in length around the off stump line, pushed out to mid-on
lands on the leg, moves towards middle,. pushed to the on side
edged wide of backward point. It was a full-length delivery slanting away from Guna who squirts it aerially, down to third man
Another wide down the leg. They even run the bye as Kamran fumbles. And one more as the throw goes wide of stumps with no proper back up. WAsim Akram murmurs, "Pressure pressure and pressure"
gets back to push this to point.
walks a step or two down the track, that high back lift comes crashing down and whips the back-of-length delivery through midwicket
gets behind the line to punch this one out to mid-off
full length delivery around off, driven to mid-off.

edged but lands safe. RIsky hit on a pitch that aids seam movement. He tried to fetch a ball angling across him and whack it across the line and it balloons over backward point. Three fielders rush but it lands in the middle.
compact forward punch this time from Kumar. So its clear, he is the man who will play proper conventional hold-up job while Guna tries some Sri Lankan flair

dropped by Kamran or did it go off the back thigh? It cut across from the leg stump line, went right across the batsman who was squared-up in defense. the ball flew to left of Akmal, who was initially moving to his right. He then threw a big dive with outstretched left hand but couldn't hold on. Replays don't confirm an edge. It seems it went off the thigh.
works this one away for a quiet single
Good thinking; he went for the bouncer but pushed it wide down the leg side.
a jaffa! Cracker of a delivery, it kicked up from a good length and just about held its line, Kumar pushed inside the line and was beaten. To his credit, he didn;'t chase it

full in length around off and this time Kumar moves forward and across towards the line of the delivery and punches it on the up.  Crisp shot and the ball went quickly and bounced over point fielder who leaped to get it back. Shehzad.
fuller, straighter and it has been driven to right of mid-off for a quick single. Afridi doesn't take it cleanly; had he stopped it he might have a had a chance at the run at the non striker's end

Shout for lbw turned down. Will they go for UDRS? They don't.. hold on wait.. they go for  it after considerable deliberations. It landed full in length on the leg and middle stump line. It landed in line and straightened to hit him in front. That's out and Harper gives it out. Guna was playing too much across the line and has paid for it now. As he walked away Guna, suggested that there was an inside edge.
around the off stump line, stays back to defend

Another UDRS. This time by the batsman. Another lbw shout. This landed full in length on the middle and cut in towards leg. It hit him above the knee roll. It cut in sharply and might be missing leg stump. The on field umpire had given it out though, so will they reverse it? Hawk eye says it would have missed leg. And the decision has been reversed. NOT OUT
on the middle stump line, pushed back to the bowler
full in the length and it kicks up outside off stump, the batsman is beaten, going for the drive

Clatter! Around 129 kmph delivery and it was the typical Razzaq dismissal. That one that has troubled the likes of SRT. It landed full in length just outside off and skidded towards middle and off line. Kumar went for a drive, and went slightly outside the line. It goes through the bat and pad gap.
just outside off stump, just about holds its line and pushed out to the off side
Two slips in and they watch the batsman being hurried by the pace of Gull. He is getting them to skid
swing and a miss. Lovely teasing full delivery outside off stump, he goes for a flamboyant off drive but no wood on leather.
on the off stump line, defended to the on side
the bouncer arrives and the batsman goes down under

Risky but he pulls it off. It was full and on the middle stump line, it almost looking heading towards the pad when Surkari got his bat down and whipped it away, pretty stylishly I must add, through midwicket
goes for the yorker, serves a low dipping full toss, worked behind square-leg for a single
leans forward, head over the ball, bat and pad close together and defends
good delivery, cuts away a fraction from back of length and pushed out to cover. The captain wanted a single and just about gets back in time
straightens on the off stump line, from a good length, pushed out to cover
leans forward to defend it back down the track
almost caught! It was a full-length delivery around off, driven uppishly but just short of mid-off.
leans forward to defend to the off

Loud shout for lbw Another DRS. It looked high. It landed short of length outside off and cut in towards middle. Bagai was on the hop when it hit him really high. That would have missed the middle.  And Hawk eyes confirm it. Harper reverses his decision. NOT OUT
stays back to punch it through cover for couple of runs
around the off stump line, punched to the bowler
around the off stump line, punched out to the off side
Loud shout for lbw but there was an inside edge. WHat a dramatic night. Action every ball. It was the full delivery straightening on the middle and he did get a big inside edge
short in length outside off, pushed out to point
full in length on the middle, that front pad again comes dangerously across before the bat appears in time and he pushes it to mid-on
similar delivery but this time much better stuff from the batsman. Pakistan are going for lbw. The front pad didn't come across and he drove to left of mid-on
Razzaq is gunning for that lbw. This time jabbed away of the inside edge
slightly short and it has been pulled over wide mid-on for couple of runs
short in length outside off, cut to left of backward point where Shehzad makes a diving stop
gets forward to defend it back to the bowler
short in length outside off stump, punched out to the off
presses right back to defend to point
full in length on the middle, pushed out to the on side
That lbw again. Boy, they are going after it every ball. This one too cuts back in, the front leg is pushed across but the bat comes around just in time to stab the ball the leg side
shorter in length and that allows the batsman to sit back and push it to the off side
full in length just outside off, Bagai stayed adjacent to the line and creamed it to right of point where a diving stop is made
straightens just outside off stump, steered past backward point
gets across to push it to the off

stifled shout for lbw. The batsman need to be careful about their technique here: can't be pushing so much across when it should be obvious now what the bowlers are doing. This time the point of impact was outside off.
taps this to the on side
a bouncer outside off stump, Surkari thinks about a pull but withdraws
around the off stump line, defended to point region
full delivery on the off and middle, driven back to the bowler
The first shout for lbw comes in. From Afridi ie. The batsman was on the front foot and perhaps, struck just outside off.
leans forward to defend this leg break
tossed up really full, driven down to long-off
leg break outside off, pushed through cover point
stays back to punch this back-of-length delivery to deep point
Good move from the batsman. Tired of being in threat of sitting duck for that lbw , he walked forward and across, got outside the line of off stump and played the leg glance to fine-leg
short in length and he goes for the pull. But is late on it. The ball hits the body and rolls to the off
He walks down the track again and Razzaq fires across  a bouncer! Bagai just about ducks. He showed his cards too early there
full in length just outside off stump, defended to the off
Nice crispy shot. It was a short-of-length delivery a touch wide outside off, Bagai leaned across and steered it aerially to third man
on the middle and off line, tapped to short midwicket
almost lands this one at the blockhole, dug out to cover
slower, around off, eased through cover point for a single

Shout for lbw but point of impact was outside off. They think about going for review but decide against it. It landed outside off stump line and just about straightened and the batsman was hit outside off
slips to the leg side, goes for a sweep but doesn't connect well
the slider on the middle stump, that lbw looked so juicy there, but the batsman just about manages to get an inside edge on the defensive poke
around the off stump line, pushed out to cover
Whack! The break-free shot. The Canadian captain plays a cracking square cut.
short in length, straightens on the middle stump, climbs waist-high, pushed out to off
in the zone outside off, a touch fuller, he goes for the forcing shout through the off but doesn't connect
on the off stump line, tapped to right of point. They think about a single but very quickly kill that thought
just outside off stump, pushed out to point
gets forward to defend the good-length delivery
slips this wide down the leg side
ooh! It was full in length on the middle and off and Surkari was in all sorts of a tangle. He chose to go back and just about managed to stab it away to the off
gets forward this time to defend to the off
slower, bit more air, eased to cover
Shout for lbw Turned down. They wonder about the decision review but decide against it. It was on the leg stump line and would have gone down the leg, with the angle
leans forward to push it to the on side
fetches it from outside off and laps it to the on side
short in length just outside off, punched out to backward point
straightens on the middle stump, pushed to the on side for a single
on the middle, again looking for the lbw but the two seems to have got slightly better at dealing with it. The front leg doesn't come too far across and the ball has been worked wide of midwicket
shortish delivery around off, he stays adjacent to the line and runs it down to third man
full and well outside off, Surkari throws his arms at it but doesn't connect
short in length around off, pushed out to point

loud appeal for lbw Harper turned it  down.  They go for the review. Looks plumb. It landed full on the middle stump line and it just about straightened enough to trap him in front. Harper reverses his decision. Bagai has to go. He drags himself off the park. Finally, it was that lbw that got him. It almost seemed inevitable that that's the way this was going to end.
on the middle and leg, full and looking for that lbw again! the new batsman ensured the leg never got in way as he defended
leans forward and across to defend to the off
quicker delivery, goes back very quickly to defend
nice.. a lot slower, on the middle and leg, just about straightens, defended on the front foot

Whoa! Hansra plays a pretty flamboyant pick-up shot over wide midwicket. It was delivered with a round-armish action - Afridi uses that when he wants to loop his leg break and get it to turn - but Hansra strode forward and flicked it up and over
stays at his crease to work this to the on side for a single
moves outside leg and hits this to mid-off. Interesting. It looks like Hansra has decided to be aggressive from the word go
on the middle stump line, pushed out to cover
in the zone outside off, Hansra doesn't get across - perhaps worried about that lbw- and lunges across to try punching it through off but makes no contact
around the off stump line, pushed out to point
around the off stump line, defended to the off
leans forward to defend to the off side
tries the cute late cut on a bent knee but makes no contact. It wasn't too far from the off stump. Too full to play that shot unless your name is Arjuna Ranatunga or GR Vishwanath
gets forward to drive through mid-off for a single
gets back to try to work it to the on side and it rolls away
slower, draws the batsman forward and across to a delivery that pitches outside off, squirted out to gully
leans forward to push this leg break to the off
in the channel outside off stump, Surkari just hangs his bat out to dry. Comprehensively beaten

Fine stuff from Asad Shafiq. It was slashed to his left at third man. He charged across and made a diving half-stop. the ball rolled away towards the rope. He got up, rushed forward and pushed the ball back in time
just outside off stump, punched out to the off
on the middle and off, pushed out to cover
this one goes well outside the off stump, left alone
straightens on the middle, again Hansra shows good technique: he works this one to midwicket
just outside off stump, leans across to push it to cover
around the off stump, steered to backward point
straightens on the off stump line, stabbed to the o nside
that typical Afridi slider on the middle stump line, jabbed off the inside edge to square-leg. Wahab's throw lands awkwardly in front of Akmal and hits him on the left arm. Ouch
pushed out to the point region
gets forward and across to defend the leg break to the off
around that off stump again, pushed out to cover
Big swing and a miss. He moved outside leg and tried to heave across the line. The shortish delivery flew over the blade

Good stuff from the bowler. He tries to catch Hansra with a delivery slanted across him, making him play away from the body. Hansra lunges out to drive and gets the edge and it goes past the lone slip and runs away to the boundary
moves towards the line of the delivery this time and drives to cover
a pacy bouncer, around 140 kmph delivery, the batsman sways away from the line of fire.
short in length, on the middle, worked away to right of mid-on for a single
The bouncer arrives and the batsman is late on the pull, beaten by the pace. But the ball flies of the top edge and runs down to fine-leg boundary.
Slip in place. Younis Khan is the man. Tossed up around off and middle, defended to the on side
turns into the leg stump line, moves past the poke and hits the pad
leans forward to flick to right of midwicket where Afridi fires a direct hit at the striker's end.
stretches his right foot well forward and across and though he was hit on the pad, the point of impact was outside off.
He fetched it from outside off and paddled it to fine-leg region
Nicely played. It turned in from outside off, from back of length and that allowed the batsman to press back, open the bat-face and cut it past slip
turns in to the off stump line, defended to the off
Oh superbly played cut. There was some width on it, not too much but just about enough for Hansra to rock back and cut deliciously to right of backward point
gets well back to defend to the on side
moves back to clip the off break to the leg side
gets forward and across to defend this delivery, a lot slower in the air
the toppie arrives, Hansra picks it well and pushes it to the off
skips down the track and whips the off break from outside off to right of midwicket
gets behind the line to defend
The doosra arrives and Hansra is in trouble. He pushed out at it but there was no slip! Edge and it goes through to third man
off break this time, he goes for the reverse paddle but doesn't connect too well. The ball rolls to slip
on the leg stump line, slower and the batsman loses balance on the front foot and stumbles across as he tries to defend. He is hit on the pad but going down leg
moves down the track, gets outside the off and is hit on the pad, trying to on drive
is hit on the pad, trying to work it to the on side
just outside the off stump, is beaten, trying to cut
leans well forward to push this to the leg side
moves forward to tap this back to the bowler
on the middle, turning in, squeezed behind square-leg
short in length, turns in to the pad, worked to short fine-leg
flighted on a length outside off, pushed out to cover
short in length, turning into the leg stump line, dragged down to fine-leg region
The doosra on the offstump line, Hansra doesn't read it and  tries to paddle it and is hit on the right arm.
it's the off break this time and he paddles it to fine-leg
moves down the track, gets too close to the ball and jabs it to the on side
turns in to the middle stump line, chopped down through backward point
backs to the on side and dabs this to the leg

Almost ala Salim Malik. Just for the fact that he moved outside leg even before the delivery. Malik used to do this a lot. Of course he was one of the best players of spin. Hansra moves outside leg and crashes the off break through extra cover
gets forward to push it away
this time he walks to the off and paddles a slow delivery from outside off to fine-leg

the topppie outside off, the batsman gets the edge to backward point as he tries to drive. There was confusion over the single, and had Ajmal collected it cleanly, it might have got interesting as Hansra was outside his crease, trying to get back
taps this behind square-leg for a single

Edge but lands safely It was a flighted delivery from round the stumps, Hansra lunges forward to stab at it and it lobs up on the leg side. Ajmal rushes, so does the midwicket but it lands between them
again moves outside leg, waits before leaning into an off drive to long-off
spins down the leg and kisses the pad
unfurls the sweep shot to pick up a single
just outside leg - not the line to bowl when you want wickets - rolls away of the pad
still from round the stumps, Hansra yet again moves outside leg, Ajmal flights it outside off and Hansra slices it of the edge over point
on the middle and leg, worked to midwicket
from over the stumps, just outside off, driven to long-on
short in length, deflected to midwicket
brings the 50 of the partnership with a crispy drive to deep cover. 91 to win from 116 balls
spins towards leg and hits the pad
gets forward and across and squeezes the top spinner to right of backward point for a quick single
from round the stumps, full and outside leg stump, Hansra tries the reverse sweep and edges it to his pad. They shout for lbw but there was a thick edge
turns into leg stump line, goes through bat and pad gao, hits the pad and rolls away to short third man
doosra from round the stumps, Hansra goes for the sweep and is hit on the body.

Lbw turned down. Harper turns it down. They go for the review.  It was slightly quicker, lands on a good length around the leg stump and just about straightens. Hawk eye says it would have just clipped the leg stump and that it will be an on-field call. Not OUT is the verdict.
low dipping full toss, on driven to long-on
gets well forward to squeeze this to square-leg
turns into the off, deflected to midwicket
Larruped! Hansra has really turned this game around. He rushed down the track and smashed it over long-off. The batsmen punch their gloves.
gets forward to defend to the on side
leans forward to work this around to short midwicket
shuffles to the off and tries to paddle it around. he misses and the ball almost hits the leg stump
gets forward to defend it back to the bowler
flighted full delivery on the middle, too full, pushed back to the bowler
from round the stumps, on the leg, swept to short fine-leg fielder

loud shout for lbw The quick seam-up delivery. They go for another review as the umpire negates this one as well! It landed full in length on the leg stump line, moved across with the arm, hit the pad in front of the middle - the ball clipped the pad before it hit the bat - and it would have hit the off stump. Looks out. And the verdict is OUT. Harper has to reverse another decision. And Surkari trudges off in complete disappointment
wide slip in place. From round the stumps and another one that goes on with the arm outside off, the batsman is beaten, trying to defend
this one is a wide down the leg side
goes back to push it to the on side and edges it to his pad
Another wide down the leg side!
in the zone outside off and Akmal collects
on the leg and middle line, squeezed out through backward square-leg
on the middle stump, defended to the off.
There we go! We have heard that this bloke can give it a thump. Cheema heaves this googly over wide mid-on.
slides down the leg and hits the pad.
the quickish slider on the middle, Cheema has to be really wary about this delivery- he just about chops it to point

Clatter! What a lovely intelligent delivery. It was a lot slower than what Cheema anticipated. He was way too early into his attempted big heave-ho to the on side. The ball came on slowly and broke back in from outside off to gently hit the off stump.
from round the stumps, lands outside leg and hits the pad
doosra from round the stumps, just outside leg, edges the defensive push to backward point
goes right back to defend to the on side
stays back to punch this to cover
lands around off and turns sharply to Kamran
around the off stump line, tapped towards backward point for a quick single. The fielder was too deep there
lands outside leg and breaks across, defended to the off . It was the off break, not the googly
Another off break, punched away to sweeper cover
on the pads, drifts down leg to hit the pad

Shahid Afridi has done it again. It was that typical drifting and skidding slider. It landed on a good length around off and hurried on towards the off stump. Hansra makes a mistake of trying to cut. He tries to bring the bat down in an hurry but the ball is quicker. The off stump is pegged back/. A very fine innings but it's over now.

What a quick ripper! It was the pacy seam-up delivery. Afridi the leggie had transformed into Afridi the pacer. It landed full in length and breached the defenses of a surprised Baidwan. He had no clue and hence, no chance to save his stumps. The ball rushed through the hurried poke, hit the pad and fell on the stumps. Pakistan fans would remember the dismissal of Greg Blewett (or was it Steve Waugh)
Another quick seam-up. Whoosh! The batsman just about manages to get some bat on it
Thump! Gordon clears the front foot and hammers this delivery from the off stump to wide midwicket boundary.
The doosra almost gets him. It moved past the clueless defensive poke and hit the pad but going down leg side
stays back to push it to the off
gets forward to defend to the off
works this behind square-leg
the doosra but it slips down the leg side and Akmal is not quick enough
turns away from the off, Gordon is beaten, trying to cut
it slips down the leg side and Akmal appeals for a catch. Wide given. But it brushed the pad
this time there was no pad and it was definitely a wide
slower, leg break around off, defended to point
rolls away to short fine-leg and they take the run
around the pads, swept to fine-leg

Afridi throws his head back and roars as he looks up to the sky. Wahab has taken a good catch in the end, after misjudging initially. It was the googly and Gordon skied the slog. Wahab came in from the deep, almost looked as if he would not take it as he stuttered as he came near the ball and then lunged out to take a good catch in the end.
The umpire turns down a lbw decision and Afridi asks for the review. It was the googly and the batsman was struck clearly outside the off stump, trying to defend it.. Nigel Llong had got it right.
ha! much fun! This was that pacy one - 129. 4 kmph! - and the batsman some how manages to get some bat on it. A smiling afridi suggests he can bowl a bouncer and the batsman smiles
full in length just outside off, edges the defensive shot to his pad
stays back to defend to the off
Big swing and a miss. He tried to Akram hit., clear the fornt foot and swing to the on side.. He misses.
full and around the leg stump line ..
More heat! the bouncer arrives and Balaji takes it on the body. Ouch. Shehzad claps, Gul stares, Balaji asks him to get on with it!
the slower one and Balaji doesn't connect
gets back to defend to the on side
bounces from short of length around off, jabbed to the off
around the leg stump line, turns in, he misses the sweep and is hit on the pad
stays back to cut this to backward point
presses back to work this to the off
slower, flighted, plays it uppishly but short of long-off
full length delivery on the off, edges the intended off drive to his pad
full delivery around off, driven for a single
pushes this one away for a single

Balaji is run out Afridi is having some night here. Balaji had set off for a single but his partner wasn't keen. Balaji turned and saw that Afridi had the ball at mid-off. He gave up and just watched Afridi let rip a direct hit at the non striker's end
good-length delivery around off, defended on the front foot
the slower one down the leg side and Akmal gathers
slower one outside off, cut away for a single
full and just outside off, the ball goes past the waft and Akmal collects
full again, angled across the batsman who slices it to third man
wide outside off stump and an unhappy Kamran screams, "C'mon!"
well outside off, left alone
from round the stumps, full and outside off, big swing and a miss from the batsman
Pakistan win by 46 runs. Full, straight and fast. The bat is late in coming down. Clatter!
